<doc> Tooltips

== Description ==

This page describes the HOP API for tooltips. A tooltip, is a static
HTML tree that is by hidden and that pops up when the mouse flies over
reactive regions.

~~ Note: ,(<SPAN> :style { font-weight: bold; color: red } [
The markup presented in this page is not yet supported on
client side programming. It is only supported on server side.])

== Synopsis ==

=== Server ===

  (<TOOLTIP> args ...)

=== Client ===

  (tooltip-hide)

=== Requirements ===

Client codes using //Tooltips// need to load the script
++hop-tooltip.js++.  That is, user interfaces using //Tooltips// must
include in their header, the following statement:


  (<HEAD> :include "hop-tooltip")


== Examples ==

<example><TOOLTIP></example>

== Server Definitions ==
<server>

=== ++<TOOLTIP>++ ===
<markup> <TOOLTIP>

<arguments>
^  attributes  ^   type    ^   default    ^  short description           ^
| :id          |  string   |  //random//  | element identifier.          |
| :onclick     |  script   |              | the action to executed.      |
| :onmouseout  |  script   |              | the action to executed.      |
| body         |  xml      |              | the content of the tooltip.  |
</arguments>

The arguments :onclick and :onmouseout are scripts that are executed
before hiding the tooltip.

</markup>
</server>

== Client Definitions ==
<client>

=== ++(tooltip-hide)++ ===
<procedure> tooltip-hide

This function hides the tooltip currently displayed.
</procedure>
